body.p: Oracc OB-Freie Regular (Oracc-OBF) is a minor adaptation of the No-Latin version of Corvin Ziegeler's OB-Freie Regular font (OBF) version 2.0.0, OBNLFreie-Regular.otf. The sign forms are based on C. Mittermayer, Altbabylonische Zeichenliste der sumerisch-literarischen Texte, listed in OSL as ABZL.
The original font was obtained from https://github.com/crzfub/OB-Freie/blob/main/OBFreie on 2024-11-05.
Oracc OB-Freie Regular is licensed under the SIL Open Font License, Version 1.1 as required by the licensing terms of OB-Freie.

In the draft Oracc guidelines for use of OT features these would probably be SALT variants. A future version of Oracc-OBF could redefine the .ss01 characters as .1, etc.

In Oracc projects the font is selected with the CSS class ofs-oobf. Because the design size of Oracc-OBF is slightly smaller than Oracc-Noto this page also uses ofs-150 to enlarge the Oracc-OBF characters.
